meanings.definition: To postpone or put off an action or event.
meanings.sent1: She kept delaying her homework until it was almost bedtime.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam was delaying our arrival at the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat was delaying its pounce on the toy mouse, making the game more exciting.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were delaying the sunrise, casting a shadow over the morning.
meanings.sent5: The procrastinator's habit of delaying tasks led to a pile of unfinished work.

meanings.definition: To cause to be late or slow.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain was delaying the construction work on the road.
meanings.sent2: His slow pace was delaying the group's progress on the hike.
meanings.sent3: The snail was delaying the race, much to the amusement of the spectators.
meanings.sent4: The tangled wires were delaying the internet connection, frustrating the user.
meanings.sent5: The faulty alarm clock was delaying his wake-up time, making him late for work.

meanings.definition: The act of delaying or being delayed.
meanings.sent1: The delay in the train schedule caused inconvenience for the passengers.
meanings.sent2: The delay in the delivery of the package was due to bad weather.
meanings.sent3: The delay in the movie start time led to impromptu popcorn sharing among the audience.
meanings.sent4: The delay in the flight departure made the passengers anxious about missing their connections.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected delay in the meeting gave him extra time to prepare his presentation.
